case_title: MUHAMMAD HASHIM KHAN AND OTHERS vs PROVINCE OF BALUCHISTAN AND OTHERS
complaint_summary: Petitioners, who are civil servants, alleged illegal dismissal, compulsory retirement, transfer, and denial of seniority.
investigation_summary: The court reviewed the establishment of the Baluchistan Services Tribunal under Act V of 1974 and its exclusive jurisdiction over civil servant service matters.
judgment_summary: The petitions were dismissed as the matters fell under the exclusive jurisdiction of the Baluchistan Services Tribunal established under Act V of 1974. The Tribunal was deemed a civil court under Section 5 of Act V of 1974, with powers under the Code of Civil Procedure, and had authority to examine mala fide actions and ultra vires laws.
legal_arguments: Tribunal's exclusive jurisdiction under Act V of 1974
Bar on other courts under Article 212(2) of the Constitution
Tribunal's authority to examine mala fide actions and ultra vires laws
statutes: Provincial Services Tribunal (Extension of the Provisions of the Constitution) (Amendment) Act, 1976
Article 212 of the Constitution of Pakistan
key_issues: Conflict with Fundamental Rights under Article 25 of the Constitution

legal_terms.ultra vires: Beyond the legal power or authority of a person or institution

words_and_phrases.abate: To put an end to or nullify
words_and_phrases.exclusive jurisdiction: Authority of a tribunal or court to hear and decide specific types of cases

summary_vector_notes: The case involved multiple petitions by civil servants challenging their dismissal, compulsory retirement, transfer, and denial of seniority. The court ruled that the Baluchistan Services Tribunal had exclusive jurisdiction over such matters under Act V of 1974, and dismissed the petitions accordingly.

legal_basis.primary_legislation: Baluchistan Services Tribunal Act, 1974 (Act V of 1974)
legal_basis.constitutional_provisions: Article 212 of the Constitution of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan
legal_basis.amendment_legislation: Provincial Services Tribunal (Extension of the Provisions of the Constitution) (Amendment) Act, 1976

key_points.tribunal_establishment: Service Tribunal established under Section 3 of Act V of 1974.
key_points.exclusive_jurisdiction: Tribunal has exclusive jurisdiction over matters relating to terms and conditions of service of civil servants, including disciplinary matters.
key_points.jurisdiction_limitation: Certain matters excluded from Tribunal jurisdiction under Section 4 of Act V of 1974.
key_points.constitutional_extension: Clause (2) of Article 212 extended to Tribunal by Parliament in 1976.

petitioners_grievances: Illegal dismissal, removal, or compulsory retirement from service.
Transfer and relieving of additional post in public interest.

respondent_arguments.maintainability_objection: Petitions not maintainable due to exclusive jurisdiction of Service Tribunal.
respondent_arguments.constitutional_provision: Article 212 is an enabling provision allowing provincial legislature to determine Tribunal scope.

additional_notes.rules_framed: Rules under Act V of 1974 gazetted on 22-4-1976.
